title: Z3 (computer)
summary: The Z3 was a German electromechanical computer designed by Konrad Zuse in 1935, and completed in 1941. It was the world's first working programmable, fully automatic digital computer.[1] The Z3 was built with 2,600 relays, implementing a 22-bit word length that operated at a clock frequency of about 5–10 Hz.[2] Program code was stored on punched film. Initial values were entered manually.[3][4][5]: 32–37
